name: Abby Fowler
text:
I went there recently for an eye exam and I have never felt so uncomfortable at an eye doctor in my life. The ladies at the front desk were lovely, but the man who did my prescreening was awful. He was rude right off the bat. I'm generally a nervous person when it comes to doctors and I like to know what's going on, however when I was asking questions about what he was trying to do to me, he got annoyed and kept trying to rush me into doing things. This automatically put me off, and made me feel unsafe. The puffer  test, for Glaucoma always has made me really nervous, but usually I try my best to get through it. However, I felt so unsafe and uncomfortable in the small room with this man that I was not about to do anything I wasn't comfortable doing to begin with. When it came to doing the eye mapping, he kept getting frustrated because he wasn't getting a good picture and ended up pushing my head pretty hard into the equipment. I wish I would've left at this point, but I figured it was probably just all in my head. He asked if he could hold open my eye, but made no attempt to even put on a glove, and at this point I had 0 trust in the guy. When I went into the exam room, the doctor was condescending. I try to tell doctors that I get anxious around them, and it typically helps the appointment go smoother, but she as well rushed me through everything which made me feel really uncomfortable. She then went to put drops in my eye, because I denied the puffer test and became really mad and threw down her paper towels she was holding when I refused. I know it is an important test, but they didn't try to establish any trust, and made me feel really freaked out and uncomfortable. I figured I don't have to go here again, and will take the test with a doctor who I actually trust, and who treats their patients with kindness.

To sum it up I will never be going to this location again, nor will I suggest it to anyone. They made me feel uncomfortable and unsafe.

name: jackson phillips
text: Had an absolutely awesome experience with the staff here. Great customer service and speedy service!

name: Jessica Davis
text:
I should have read the review prior to booking an appointment.  Still I didn't learn from them overcharging me from last year, that was partly due to my not so great insurance coverage.  I've been wearing corrective lenses for decades.  This would be my second visit to this office, I was in need of new glasses and my old prescription expired, so I dropped in on my lunch break.  This was one of few places my insurance covered.  The office assistants were nice.  They tried to upsell my dilation but I told the girl that I wanted to keep everything under my insurance coverage.  Everything went fine until I had to wait 45 minutes for Dr. Davis finish her causal conversation with the patient next door. When she finally appeared, she touched base on the astigmatism in my left eye.  I've had an astigmatism in that eye for years and there has yet to be any issues about it.  She said she wanted to try a specific contact lens for that eye, she would order me free trial and that I'm to come back for a follow-up.  She also suggested that I change my disposable contact lens from daily to weekly.  She asked if I slept in them, I said no because I rub my eyes in my sleep and I have symptomatic reactions with allergies which causes severe protein buildup.  She said she will write a prescription for some allergy drops.  I didn't think I needed them because I haven't had an allergic reaction like that in a while. So I thought I would just not get the prescription.  Finally I am about to check-out and the lady at the desk, Sarah, tells me that my final total is over $100.  I only assumed that my copay would be $40. Sarah said that my eye exam "became a medical visit because the written prescription for the eye drops and the specialized fit for the new contact lens we are ordering."  I was blown away.  I had no room in my budget for that.  I know I signed the form understanding there would be extra costs but they should at least TELL me as they are working what costs are to be incurred.  Sarah saw I was distraught and made and additional comment, "You know, I'm working on getting a coupon for these drops.  I don't know what your co-pay is, but these drops are expensive.  The coupon will make sure you don't pay more than $25. Oh and the follow-up visit is free."  Thanks but no thanks, you obviously know what you were doing and got caught.  I don't plan to fill out the unnecessary prescription.  I don't plan to use this office again.  I'll go back to get the rest of my contact prescription and that's it.  No more.  I've been seeing an ophthalmologists for, years under basic insurance and my copay was not over $20, let alone any surprise charges for a non-invasive visit.  My suggestion is to go elsewhere.  A medical office is supposed to take care of their patients, not rob them blind.

Update 7/18/2014:  I came back for my follow up for my contact fitting.  This time I was seen by Dr. Bradley.  He asked about the contacts that were given to me, I told them that the left lens was difficult to adjust to because it was thicker than the right lens and that with my new job, I'm looking at a computer more so they dry out faster.  He examined my eyes and found out that it wasn't the computer use that was drying out my eyes.  He said the contact lens material was not working with my body chemistry and that my tears were being repelled from the lens and not being absorbed for normal wear.  He then looked closer at my prescription and said that I didn't have a need for these special lens.  I was doing fine before and this was not a solution to my problem.  He referred me to use a different lens, free of charge, and crossed out Dr. Davis' previous notes in red marker.  I'm so glad there was a second opinion in the same office that could help me out.

name: Carla Crane
text: The people were nice, but over priced. Never going back because I got pink eye after my exam there. I don't think they clean their equipment well.

name: Katie Noonan
text:
Will NEVER go back & Not recommended!
My son and I drove over an hour for an eye exam. Not only were they none attentive, but did nothing but rush & try pushing my teenage son to switch from glasses to contacts. Instead of giving a teenager time to think about whether he was comfortable with contacts or wearing them, they insisted on forcing you to pay for a lesson and a contact exam on top of his glasses exam before making a decision. After leaving the first time with a horrible experience, we got a call that his lenses were in after 2 weeks. Then, after calling to make sure they’d have time to complete the service before driving the distance again, we get there to be told they had ordered the wrong lenses for his frame. The frame in which he specifically had with him at his first visit & had taken a picture of with him in them. The employees were unfriendly, unconcerned, and sat there arguing with me about them having more than one frame listed in the system for him as an excuse. Regardless of the fact that his current frames were there with him on his exam visit & they were responsible for making sure they ordered the lenses for that exact frame! They completely disregarded checking the frame model he had with him before ordering the new lenses I paid $362 for, and we were not only out of another long drive for nothing, but ended up being  left without him having his glasses. Completely unacceptable! Do not waste your time with this location.

name: DaVida Stephens
text: I super loved my experience at 2798 John Hopkins Parkway in Hoover store #112!!! From the phone with Sarai (Sarah) she was very understanding and actually took the time to schedule my son same day without an appointment!!! That was a big deal due to my schedule. Thanks Sarai!!! When we got there her awesomeness was present she welcomed us and was very nice and professional!!! I was also welcomed by Rowena... she added elegance by her nice welcoming customer service and her beautiful pink 2 pice skirt set... and compliment of my attire! She was very professional and understanding and educated. Thanks Rowena!! Then to Ms. Linda we went... she was very calm and friendly!!! She gave me concerned vibes!! Thanks Linda. Then what completely sealed the deal for me was the wonderful Dr. Kendra Mills!!! Man I was so happy with her tenderness with me and my son. She was very understanding of my question about my son's eyes, she was very kind and caring, she was very soft and professional ❤, and such a lady!! I didn't want to leave lol!!! The entire office gave me good vibes from beginning to end. Thanks you all!!! A great experience indeed!!! Gid bless you all #gotothislocationyall

name: Greyson Davis
text:
They were all really nice. Dr. Silliman is absolutely awesome. He stayed late for me to get my exam. Someone needs to hire some MORE people. But the people that are there really work hard to get EVERYTHING done. They are constantly running around and smiling while doing it.

HOWEVER if you are trying to call and get ANY information about an order you gave them $709 for you’re not going to get it. You get put on hold before you can even say “okay” or no I don’t want to be on hold I’ll just call back. If you aren’t making an appointment you’re forgotten. I got tired of holding after 30 min and called again, someone answered and said I was going to have to hold and I said no I’ll just call back later and she said wel, someone can take your call now.... SHE PUT ME ON HOLD and I sat there for about a minute until I was angry and gave up. All I wanted to know was if they could provide me with an expected delivery date of my glasses because I live pretty far from the office and would like to have a little bit of a plan as to when I’ll have to go back to pick them up. 2 hours later... still no info

Okay I take it back, UPDATE maybe they were having a Monday and I was too because I just called and they were super nice. Sometimes people just have bad days and I may have called on one of those bad days for the whole store. Thank you guys for helping me see. ❤️❤️❤️

resp.text: I’m very sorry you had an unpleasant experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback.  Did they hand-write an ETA on your receipt? Orders can take up to 10 business days, not including weekends or holidays. I'd be happy to have someone from the leadership team reach out to you about this. If you'd like, please email me at americasbest@nationalvision.com.  It’s very important to include the location you visited, your name and your phone number so we can help as quickly as possible. Thank you, Nancy

name: Vanessa Whitfield
text: I had an appt. for over a month, arrived, checked in and was in waiting area when I was told if I didn't wear a mask, they could not provide service.   I explained I had a medical condition and could not wear a mask several times.  I felt discriminated against and embarassed because of the treatment I received.  I will NEVER recommend you guys to anyone.  If everyone else wears a mask and I'm 6 ft from everyone, how can my not wearing a mask affect you? It doesn't.   Makes NO SENSE.  When you can select and chose who you help IT IS DISCRIMINATION.  You lost a lot of business because of how I was treated.  Your business needs to seriously rethink customer service.  It's because of your customers, you have a business.  It is not a law nor even a state mandate that a mask is required.  Medical reason or not, what you did was disgraceful.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience. As a healthcare retail establishment, we are committed to the safety of our customers and associates. Our enhanced COVID-19 protocols can be viewed here https://www.americasbest.com/health-statement. If you have any further questions, please call 855-985-0949 or email HealthandSafety@nationalvision.com. Thank you, Nancy

name: Julie Cartledge
text: My appointment was at 1:30 and I arrived at 1:37 because of traffic delays. I was told I had to reschedule because the doctor had already gone to lunch. Besides the fact that my eye appointment would have taken more than 7 minutes, since when are people not allowed a grace period? The receptionist was quite rude and not willing to offer any explanation except that I had to reschedule. Well, I didn’t reschedule nor will I. I’m taking my business elsewhere.

name: Brenda Gonzalez
text: Great customer service and way more affordable than Schaeffer Eye Center. Dr. Mills is great. The staff has made my experience here great.

name: Pooloo UpInHere
text: To all who value friendly customer service, cleanliness and time, America's Best in Hoover is the place to go. I visited there Tuesday and was in and out. The only problem I encountered was me deciding on the perfect frames. There is a huge selection to choose from and none of them look cheap. I had such a great time there, I will choose all my exams and glasses from this location. The Dr. seemed to care about the health of my eyes and was thorough with all concerns I had. She was a joy as well as the entire staff. Shout out to Jamir for your kindness in trying to repair my old glasses. It was an absolute pleasure interacting with the everyone. Nothing negative here to say...sorry.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. We love hearing from happy customers and we appreciate your feedback and your business! – Nancy

name: Kendall Black
text:
Rude, not helpful at all during this time of crisis, sarcastic, and refused to give me the name and number of the supervisor for Angela, the store manager. Our business isn't important to this manager. I will NEVER return to this store and recommend strongly that no one else does either.

UPDATE:  I continued to use this facility, regardless of my past comments and feelings.  All b/c I had their eye care plan.  I shouldn't have done that.  Their eye care plan or whatever it's called is not worth it.  So, if you're a person that reads reviews and takes them to heart.... My advice to you is find an eye doctor that is there every time you go into their office, so you actually SEE the same eye doctor each time.  A doctor that will explain to you what's going on and makes the time to answer your questions.  A doctor that CARES about your eye health or lack there of, depending on the situation.  A doctor and his staff that know what customer service is all about.  A doctor and his staff that will work with you on the health of your eyes.  I'm dealing w/ these people today, b/c I have to.  But I won't do it again.  I don't care if I have to pay twice as much to see another eye physician.  America's Best does not care about it's patients.  Not in the least.  Not at the office level or corporate level.  It's so glaringly obvious.

text: I have been to this location several times . I got my last pair of glasses here and at that time i had no problems . The staff was very helpful and friendly. But this time the receptionist was awful. She was rude. She took my ins card  that clearly had my husbands name and employer information on it. She had me wait for over 20 minutes in the waiting area . I  walked back to the receptionist  desk to find her doing nothing and asked for my ins. card and to find out what was taking so long and she stated oh I haven’t ran your ins yet but you do have VSP . SO , I’m like how do you know that if you have not looked into the information. So she said I will in a minute very rudely. I had to ask her to pull my file if she needed additional info and  told her that i was not a new customer, everything should be in my file nothing had changed. She rolled her eyes and just sat there looking as if I was bothering her.  Then she finally looked up and said I need your husbands DOB and the last four of his social on this sticky note and you can have a seat. I said no ma’am run my ins and give me my card back please. By then they were calling me to the back for my exam. Let me just say the rest of my appointment went well . The Hispanic lady did well with helping me with my contacts ,but i honestly think they have lost a customer . I don’t have time for attitudes where I’m spending my money. I even ordered my contacts to be delivered to my address so I wouldn’t have to go back to the store and I will probably order my glasses online from another company.

text: Stephanie and the other staff were kind, courteous, and very fast. Great place!

name: Tiffany Walls
text:
I had a wonderful experience at this location. It had been about 5 years since my last eye exam. I used to suffer from horrible migraines (which I seem to have remedied) and I still do suffer from pretty frequent headaches and some other minor issues (floaters, some blurring in my vision, straining with low-light situations).

Facy was the front office associate that greeted me and verified my insurance. She was VERY sweet and helpful.

Linda did my preliminary eye exam and field testing. She was very kind, very patient and overall pleasant to interact with.

Dr. Mills is AMAZING. She is such a kind human being, she listened thoroughly while I talked about my history and concerns. She did not lose patience or make me feel rushed during my eye exam (especially when I had difficulty deciding between which two lenses looked more clear). We chatted while she checked out my eyes after dilation and she was just a joy. I love love love the experience I had with her and the fact that she is a WOC sealed the deal for me.

Cecily was a peach and walked us through what insurance would cover, our many options for lenses and frames and was able to play with some numbers so that we were able to get the most bang for our buck based on our needs.

I'll come here to update about receiving our glasses, the fitting and how things turned out but the experience overall was wonderful!

***Our glasses were ready for pickup 5 days after our appointments! We both got multiple phone calls letting us know they were ready.

The only reason that I couldn't quite give a 5 star review was that some of the staff that worked in the front were not as polite and patient (my wife didn't have such a great experience with the person who assisted her at first). Everything else was fabulous and we intend to make this our home for vision care even though it's in Hoover and we live in Calera. It was worth it!

resp.text: Hi Tiffany, Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review, we appreciate your business and look forward to helping you with your eye care and eye wear needs in the future. – Nancy

name: jennifer ivey
text: Friendly and helpful staff.

resp.text: Hi Jennifer, Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. We appreciate your business! – Nancy

name: Rhonsha' Hubbard
text: Very unprofessional staff.

name: Jacquelyn Holt
text: Horrible service.

It’s very important to include the location you visited, your name and your contact information so we can help as quickly as possible. Thank you, Nancy

name: Monique Byers
text: Very unprofessional. My appointment was at 3:00, I was told to go sit in the waiting area. I notice that they were calling other patients back.

resp.text: Hi Dakari, I’m very sorry that happened to you. Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us.  I have shared your review with the management team and I’d like to ask them to reach out to you and have the opportunity to make this right. If you’re interested, you can email me at americasbest@nationalvision.com.  It’s very important to include the location you visited and your contact information so we can help as quickly as possible. Thank you, Nancy

name: jayzwurld
text: Just great

resp.text: Hi Jayden, Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. We love hearing from happy customers and we appreciate your business! – Nancy

name: T O
text: The doctors and staff were so pleasant. They were nice,  friendly, caring,  and curteous. The doctor is funny too!!  Will definitely be back.

name: Nathan ciago
text: Was told over the phone for 110 dollors I could get an exam and glasses, I go in and they are determined to sell me a 40 dollor test or blind me for 3 days with tropicamide, then at the end of the exam the total was 115, was told 110,and did not include glasses was just an exam.after the fact no one would take the outside perscription, this doctor is a con artist little desk girls will say one thing and charge you another, I wouldn't have been able to get glasses for less then 400

name: Christy Pickering
text: Great experience! I have been to 5 different offices in the past week, looking for frames. Came here just to look but ended up purchasing because of the selection and staff. Kristin and Amber were extremely helpful and patient while I looked at almost every frame they had! They gave me honest feedback as to how the frames looked and made thoughtful suggestions based on my likes and preferences, but also encouraged me to try some I normally wouldn't have. I ended up choosing one I never would have picked up on my own!  Thank you again for the wonderful service!

name: Joyce Goodman
text: I called as a new patient having grey, blurry vision. I was seen two hours later as a work-in  patient. The doctor was thorough and caring. The staff was friendly and professional. I referred to an excellent opthalmologist who did laser surgery within a week. I have a return appointment to Southern Vision Care for a recheck of my eyes and a new pair of reading glasses. I have confidence in this practice's ability to care for my serious vision problems and to help me back into the world of clear vision.

name: David Carpenter
text:
Wow!
I spent a number of years in the eyecare profession and it takes a lot to impress me.  But Dr. Shirey and his highly attentive staff have won my personal medal of excellence.
Beyond making a personal connection, they treated me with kindness and welcomed me into their "work family."
The exam and other tests were state-of-the-art.  The doctor took time to explain the outcome to me thoroughly.  He even recommended a new type of contact lens that I was amazed that is working very well for me.
The bottom line is you get what you pay for.  Although SVC's price structure seems to be in line with other places, the  personal attention and knowledge you will benefit from here are beyond comparison.

name: Kristin Mullins
text: The nicest staff hands down and one of the most caring doctors I have been to. Highly recommend!

name: Shannon
text:
Positive: Doctor is very knowledgeable and I trusted him. Was very satisfied with the accuracy of the prescription and quality of the exam. Willing to answer questions.

Negative: This office is VERY uncooperative if you are wanting to order glasses online. The glasses that I got at the office were great but cost me $500. They did replace the lenses once because they were scratched. However, when I decided to order a pair of prescription sunglasses online (which I can get for just over $100) they made the process as difficult for me as possible. They seemed irritated with me for trying to get a better deal on glasses even though I was still coming to them for the exam. Then, they refused to give me my PD measurement with my prescription even though they had it on file and had taken the measurement for the first pair of glasses I ordered through them. Then, the woman I spoke with lied to me directly. She said that you have to have your PD measured each time you get glasses because it changes over time. False. I looked it up online and it is VERY rare that your PD will change once you are an adult who has gone through puberty. Very disappointed in their ability to function in modern times!

name: C M
text: I had a great experince. The ladies were so sweet and helped me pick out a pair of petite glasses that fit great! The doctor was incredible. He worked quickly but also listened to all of my concerns! Highly recommend!

name: Todd Seaborg
text: Absolutely fantastic service!  They got me in on a same day appointment and I received a very fast but thorough eye exam!  Great people, and a great experience!

name: Keith Bailey
text: Dr. Shirey at Southern Vision Care is the only optometrist I trust. The office staff are professional, courteous, and quick to assist patients/customers. A great experience every time. Highly recommended!

name: Mandi Sanders
text: Dr. Shirey's office is by the far the best eye care clinic I've been to. They have technology my retina specialist doesn't even have! And Dr. Shirey took the time to explain all my scan results (and show me the images) before fitting me for contacts. The front staff were very helpful and sweet. After trying several other places around town, this is where I will be going from now on.

name: S E
text: Today  is the last day that I go here. The two stars are strictly because the optometrist nice and very knowledgeable. The ladies at the front desk ALWAYS add up to $ 75 or higher of fees ( excluding co-pay) that is not cover up my insurance benefits. They pass it off has if is require or need but its not. It is very annoying. I have to constantly tell them that I do not want this added features if it not cover up my insurance provider. I contacted my insurance to ask about the fees that I was charged and they never even heard of them. It's almost has if they are making up fees for patients to pay out of pocket. Don't not go here unless your willing to pay at least $100 of out pocket even if they are you in-network provider.

name: Margaret Owens
text: Deciding to trust Southern Vision Care with my eyes has been the best medical decision I have ever made. The staff are warm, friendly, and caring, clearly following the example set by Dr. Shirey. I used to go to Sam's Club because it was close and the service was okay. However, several years ago Dr. Shirey was the doctor on duty. After experiencing his care I made the decision to go miles out of my way to Southern Vision Care. I have lived in New Jersey, Indiana, California, Georgia, and now Alabama. His office has the most modern equipment and the latest technology, and the absolute best staff I have ever experienced. As others have said, you will be doing your eyes and your spirits a favor by going to Southern Vision Care.

name: Markita Graham
text: The doctor was very friendly and nice me and my daughters love the staff! My girls were scared because it was their first visit but he made them feel comfortable...my eye doctor from now on

name: Vanessa Madere
text: Very knowledgeable staff and doctor. Great service.

name: Chrissy Marcus
text: Dr. Shirey and all of his staff were nice, professional and very helpful. I highly recommend Southern Vision Care.

name: Brian Orr
text: A great experience and advice. Thank you for being so streamlined!

name: Hobie Henning
text:
Nice doctor, but horrible staff. I decided to go to another eye doctor after the staff messing up my eye exam and then it taking multiple trips to get me in the right contacts. The staff was incredibly rude and short with me and was bad about not calling me back. I didn't like how pushy the tech was with me during my eye exam and angrily grabbing my eye-lid when I was having trouble keeping it open during the exam. I'm not a eye care specialist, but that felt very unprofessional grabbing somebody's eyelid in a dark room like that.

I've had glasses since second grade and contacts in high school and I never had this much trouble getting the right prescription or having staff treating me this rudely before. It just gave me a bad feeling about what would happen if I had an emergency and needed help. I just decided to take my business elsewhere.

name: charles cole
text: we are in are late 60s. and the doc is the best we have ever found. other doctors told my wife that she would never see good again boy were they wrong. Rebecca was a great  help everyone was helpful, including holding the door open, during the rain.  tks again chuck and rita  cole

name: Trey Bradley
text:
Today(06/2020): 1 Star
The staff, as always, were hospitable and polite. But, my opinion of Dr. Mark Shirey, who is also trying to run for public office - has changed.

Dr. Shirey was a savior to me when he helped me with a nearly debilitating ailment. I have photophobia - no I'm not scared of light. It's a diagnosis for high sensitivity to light. Bright light, and all Sun light, are very painful for me. Dr. Shirey gave me the prescription that helped me deal with this while driving, of which I can't describe how grateful I was for this. It was literally life changing.

But - during my last visit, Dr. Shirey told me that he "doesn't do that anymore". He doesn't recognize a diagnosis that's over 100 years old and recognized by all major medical institutions. His excuse was "ALDOT doesn't recognize it.", which is not true. Neither ALDOT or ALEA list any diagnosis that they do or don't recognize. The law in the state of Alabama is very clear in this regard.

When I got home, I did the research on this. I compiled the information and sent it to Dr. & Mrs. Shirey for review and follow-up. I haven't received anything back from them.

I've dealt with tremendous pain in my life, and live with severe musculoskeletal pain every day. Every day I deal with challenges doing things that most wouldn't have a second thought about. But the pain from bright light is something that stops me from being able to safely operate a vehicle. I have to close one eye and squint the other - all while they're watering. depending on how long I'm exposed, my vision just starts deteriorating - colors start blending/fading.. etc. It's not a pleasant experience when I'm without shaded lenses.

I've been very fortunate to have doctors and specialists that have helped me with a number of things in my life. Doctors that listen to their patients and seek to understand them.

This is the first time I've felt discriminated for a medical diagnosis. By a Doctor.

I'm sure Dr. Shirey didn't think of it like that, or do it out of spite. But it's still a blow to the quality of life for me. Dr. Shirey, like the rest of us, is human. But, in a position where you're responsible for providing care for and improving the quality of life for your patients, you should never assume, discount or interpret your patients plea as unimportant or conjecture.

I'm the one with the condition, not you. You're responsible for having the knowledge and authority to help me cope with the condition.

I do not take any pleasure in giving a review like this. Especially for a local owned business and a member of our community. But, I also take professional responsibility very seriously - and this was an irresponsible action that negatively affected my quality of life, where I was a patron seeking professional help to improve my quality of life. It was a request well within the realm of service that one would expect from this establishment.

This is very important as a leader in the community as well. If you want to run for office, don't start by discriminating against your own patients by directly denying them the help you're tasked with and responsible for providing.

I guess it's good practice for becoming a politician...

5 years ago: 5 Stars
I've visited this office twice and will be back. Both times I was promptly taken care of by the staff. Everyone there was polite and showed great hospitality. They have excellent equipment and are truly capable of providing great vision care.

Thanks! =)

name: Henry Robertson
text: When my daughter broke her glasses, they were able to put her lenses in a new frame and it only cost me $18 total.  Outstanding!

name: Tara Johnson
text: Great customer service and friendly associates!!!

name: Leslie Finley
text: WOW!!!  I was expecting a nightmare coming for an eye test with a 2 year old.  But the ladies at the vision center were so nice and helpful.  The entire staff was friendly but professional .  They were so nice that my Grandson, Lucas was a perfect angel.

name: Jennifer DeGaris
text: My son has had great service there.  They are kind and helpful.

name: Tiffany
text: Very friendly staff and and quick service! Great eyewear selection

name: Janet Green
text: I have to say that the ladies that work in the vision center are great.  They are very nice and very helpful.  I came in there with my prescription in hand to purchase a pair of sun glasses there.  First of all, I went in on Friday and was told that I would get a call when they were ready, probably 1 week. However, I got a call the following Monday, that they were already done.  I have went in to get adjustments on the temples, and they have been so wonderful each time, eager to get the best fit. My sunglasses were about 1/3 of the price that I was quoted from a doctors office in town.  I plan to go back there for my next pair.

name: micah nash
text: All of the ladies here do a fantastic job!  It's enjoyable every time I go.

name: Karen Caldwell-Naylor
text: I love the doctor at the vision center but she doesn't seem to keep a very close watch on the girls she hires. More times than not, they are late or not caring to answer the phones when they are there. It gets very frustrating and it makes you wonder just how much business they are losing because of it.

name: Gail Chambers
text: I have gotten excellent service from a wonderful staff at this Pearle Vision for the past 4 years.  I would highly recommend them to anyone needing any type of service for their eyes whether it  be an eye check up or buying new new frames or even just an adjustment for you eyeglasses, you'll find it all here and walk out happy.

name: Gary Hazelton
text: Excellent support converting from bi-focals to progressive lenses. Good crew to work with!

name: Wendell B
text: I had a great experience Tara was exceptional she made the vist a pleasure

name: Joy Sullivan
text:
They refused to see me because I couldn’t wear a Halloween mask due to me being a asthmatic.
Exceptions could have been made.

name: Scott Jones
text: Friendly staff, was able to get in and out relatively quickly, would recommend.

name: Jeremy (Momsboy32)
text: This place has that small town eye place feel. The people are all great. The Dr. Chambers is very pleasant and she loves sci-fi, which is always a great thing. They have a really great frame selection. The wait time was very short for me to get my new glasses. Once they came in they made sure everything was great my my new glasses. I feel like I got an exceptional deal with great service.

name: samantha pearson
text: Dr. Chambers is amazing! Katy was also very nice and helpful with finding the perfect glasses for my style. I absolutely love them! Great job all around!

name: Maggie Granger
text: I’ve always been a contacts person, but my experience with PearleVision has converted me!   The staff was knowledgeable and helpful, and they found the perfect frames for me.  I’m complimented on them all the time.  My contacts have become my backups.  I will definitely be back!

name: Ceasar Carnes
text: I saw Dr. Chambers and have to say it was the fastest eye exam I have ever experienced.  She was in a hurry from the second she entered the exam room.  I was taken aback at her abrupt dismissal of me when I had questions.  As I continued the process of choosing frames, etc. I observed how the patients were being pushed through quickly.  I don't think this type of office is for me.

name: thomas elliot
text: I came in for an exam this morning and had a wonderful experience. Dr Chambers was helpful and informative and Jason found a great pair of glasses for me. couldnt be happier.

name: Chelsea Winborne
text: I love Dr. Chambers and Dr.Matalka! (I have not yet met Dr. Mallard, but I am sure they are lovely as well.) They are both very sweet and knowledgeable. I moved to Minor, AL and I still travel to be here.

name: erin price
text: I couldn't find the frames I wanted at my doctor. They had an amazing selection my new glasses are beautiful. Thanks Pearle!

name: Donald Matheson
text: I had a very nice check up with Dr Chambers and love the new glasses!

name: Malia Bunt
text: I've lived in a few different cities and been through several different optometrists. These guys run a tight ship. They are professional and friendly. I had tried to wear contacts before but, it never worked. My eyes would get too dry or I would waste them. The doctors at Pearle Vision took the time to find a pair of contacts that work with my eyes and for that, I'm eternally grateful.

name: Mike Carrasco
text: Dr.Chamber was awesome and really wonderful.First time walk in and was greeted by friendly staff.

name: william wesson
text: Awful customer service.  My husband went in to get a copy of his prescription and they refused to give him a copy....the young lady was very rude about it...including ripping out the prescription and throwing into the trash in front of him.  I am waiting on a response from corporate on this matter.

name: ShaQuira Nichols
text: My experience was WONDERFUL! Dr. Jane Wright was AWESOME, she took her time and explained everything she was doing and was needless to say a great person who i STRONGLY recommend. Tanasia was my optician and she’s was the SWEETEST with a great sense of humor my overall experience was GREAT I loved ALL the staff ...

name: Hensley Lindley
text: In & out super quick. Optometrist was straight to the point which I loved!! I’ll be back. :)

name: Hondahaney
text: Good prices, Marx optical was $200 more for the same glasses.

name: LexCee Howlet
text: Jane Wright was EXTREMELY rude and disrespectful with ZERO patience. I WILL NEVER go back!

name: Madison Deal
text: Please save yourself the stress and choose a different doctor! This place is horrible. I was told I did my exam wrong! I did it wrong!? What. And then I was treated rudely because I told them the contacts they had me put in were giving me a headache because it was obviously the wrong prescription. They then wouldn’t check me out after I told them I was done and just wanted my prescription and to be on my way. The woman answered phones and played on the computer and had me wait even longer because she found it funny. She even said “I’m sorry you are having such a bad day” to help further my frustration and to provoke me. Then after leaving I realized they didn’t even fill out my prescription correctly and I had to go back and deal with them an hour longer! Just do not do it. Go somewhere else.

name: Charles Miller
text: In an out without a problem noice!

name: Phadra29 Strong
text: Worst experience in the world, I definitely will not be going back! Now I see why the rating is a 2. Do not waste your time or money!!!

name: Susan Berryhill
text: I have been going to the optical center at Wal-Mart for over 2 yrs now & love it!! The DR. is extremely knowledgeable, courteous & professional! Steve is excellent at his job & his level of customer service is impeccable ! The prices are very reasonable!

name: Judy Jones
text: Wow- 2 .3 stars and I Totally understand why! I had an appointment for the Day we were expecting Snow, I recieved a call on the day before canceling due to predicted weather- Understandable... I asked to buy 1 contact for my right eye and was told no, my prescription had expired- I have had problems with my right eye (which they knew). Rather than sell me one contact after THEY cancelled my appointment their choice for me would have been to wear a bad contact. Needless to say I chose another Doctor who took care of me that day very well!

name: David Shaw II
text:
In early October, my wife and I set up an appointment through Eve (Vision Center Manager) for early November. We saw her write the appointment down--both in the book and on a business card--and we left. We arrived on the morning of the appointment and we were told by Eve that I did not have an appointment and that the doctor would not be able to see me today. My wife told them that we had made the appointment a month ago, and I pulled the card out of my wallet. I was able to see the doctor--though they double-booked her--at my appointment time.

Both of our interactions with Eve felt strained. She seemed more interested in telling us about HER experiences with her vision loss rather than listening to our concerns and answering our questions. My wife had to steer her back to the intended topic several times.

The doctor was very thorough and enlightened me on my Visual Impairment and the probable cause behind it. She was the first doctor to connect my VI with any probable cause, despite the fact I was born with the disability. I feel the doctor is extremely competent in her field and would recommend her to anyone. The manager, however, needs to be replaced.

name: ibpoor
text: Cannot buy glasses at this place because it is closed. And employee with an attitude.

name: Kayla Terry
text: I called to ask how much an appointment was. I was told a certain price, and when I was finished with my exam I was charged something different. I told them about what I was told and then told he couldn't do anything but talk to the person about it. Then when checking prices for contacts, he got kind of rude with me because I wanted to check a website. Told me I wouldn't find them anywhere cheaper and if I didn't buy them there I couldn't get the rebate. After leaving I checked out line and the prices were cheaper than if I would have bought them there and got the rebate. The doctor was nice and professional, but did not look into something specifically about my eye health that I asked her to. Other than that she was good. I don't recommend going here.

name: Dani Corum
text: Doesn't even deserve one star! Went to get contacts and glasses and the lady who was fitting me for glasses was very rude. She was treating me like a child and getting frustrated with me because i couldn't keep my eyes perfectly still for her. She kept snapping at me to be still and getting very rude with me. After a while of this I went off on her. I asked for a different person and waited for the next person available. This person was much nicer but when I asked for the lady's name so that I can call management and complain he said he was the manager. I was shocked that the manager was sitting next to us the entire time and not once chastised her for the way she was acting. I requested her name again and he would not give it to me. When I went back to get my glasses a week later I got the "manager" again and when trying on my glasses I mentioned it made me feel motion sick the way they were looking when I moved my head and he got smart with me telling me to be realistic... The eye doctor was very nice though. No complaints with her but everyone else was horrible. I will not be going back. I will take my prescription somewhere else.

name: Mila Angel
text: I never back here anymore !

name: alicat asmr
text: It is amazing and I love their glasses. They are super cute.and I love the cases. The people that work their are super nice. You can also get contacts.

name: Leah Hughes
text: Great staff. Fast service.

name: Johnny Schultz
text: 5/9/2018 I stopped into the Decatur, AL Vision Center after making a store purchase to have my pupil distance (PD) measured. The center was empty with a young gal behind the counter and a young man with rubber boots sitting on the floor talking. I asked if I could get my measured as I wanted to compare pricing online with the Vision Center. I was told she could not do it as it is people with prescriptions only. Yup I should have known since it is Walmart which equates to poorest customer service.

name: LAN K
text: I went for contacts and glasses a 2018, glasses are so bad I can’t read very well and contacts tear easily, I feel totally unbalanced when walking wearing the glasses, I told the guy that helped me when I picked up my glasses that they weren’t right,, he said my eyes would adjust to them,, well it’s been several months now and I am still having the same problem,, I will never use this place again,!!!!!

name: Kate Rodgers
text: The staff is friendly and helpful!

name: Lance Flood
text: I was initially seen a few years ago, paid for my exam, and was told that since my diabetes was not under control they couldn't help me.  I was not given a refund but simply told to return once my numbers were under control.  I finally returned today after a long struggle and experiments with everything from daily Lantus to weekly Bydureon.  I was told that since it's been over a year, I would have to pay again.  What?  That isn't what I was told.  I didn't receive the service I paid for.  Either refund my money, or sit me back in the exam chair with the eye doctor who reeks like cigarette smoke.  Nevertheless, I was given neither option.  I will never use this place again.  Granted, it was "only" $50.00, but the principle remains that they received $50.00 and failed to deliver their service, nor was I informed of an expiration policy.  Shady.

name: Derek Beaty
text: I'll give 2 stars just because it was decent at one point. Wouldn't recommend it now with Stig in charge.

name: Joseph Ridenhour
text: I got a frame that my wife hated.  Uh oh.  Went back in the next business day, and the gentleman there was very helpful in pointing out a pair of frames that was similar in style to my old Timberland frames, but with extra viewing area and thinner and lighter titanium than the old pair!  So yeah... get the insurance for your frames, just in case.... and make sure to get your anti-reflective coating.  It's not a filter... it's an anti-filter to stop glare and allow most of the light to pass through lens instead of glancing off.  So the lens doesn't look like clear plastic, and so you don't see your eyeballs in your lens.

name: kenneth williams
text: My wife and I had appointments together here on the same day. The doctor was nice. But the Assistant Manager named Eve was very rude. She really needs to listen to her customers instead of having her stinking attitude. She really has no respect for customers nor does she have customer service skills. She really should be fired and should respect all customers not just men.

name: Jennifer Hill
text: The absolute worst customer service in ANY medical field that I have ever experienced. Very Poor management. Eve has a problem actually LISTENING to the any customer. She seems to just want to assert her attitude and her "authority" instead of actually solving any problems for the CUSTOMER! It appears she gets a real kick out of arguing and should not be in the customer service business. They ordered the wrong contacts and instead of listening to the problem Eve threatened to throw the wrong ones away if I did not pick them up without offering to resolve anything. I'm appalled and frustrated by the entire experience.

name: Vermonica Buckelew
text: After trying three different times to get appt I actually made one for today at 12:15, arrived 10 minutes early and after waiting a bit the manager comes out to tell they would have to do only part of my exam today and come back at a later date because since the appt was later in the day it would go into the doctors lunch time. I work at a veterinarian clinic and when we make appt, even if it goes into the doctors lunch time, we finish the appt. I even arrived early so it was by no means my fault if they scheduled an appt wrong. I would recommend not wasting your time here.

name: Stacy Newsom
text: Good

name: Gerald. Lynn Bradley
text: Been 7 days .Are my glasses in ?

name: Bobby Flurry
text: Love these clothes! They last a very long time.  Seriously,  I have shirts that are 15 years old that I still wear. They look relatively new. I also love the NEXT plan. The extra off is usually a surprise and makes me happy! The staff is always friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing what an awesome experience you had with the team at the Bel Air Mall EXPRESS. We forwarded your feedback to the District Manager so that they know what a special time you all had in the store. If you should have any additional questions, feel free to reach us at 1-888-397-1980.

name: A1aerials Droner
text: Great place for competitive paying jobs.

name: Dani Cakes
text:
My son, who is kind of shy, had a school dance coming up so we were in need of a suit. We didn’t know where to start and neither my son nor I had any confidence in what to even look at.
When we walked in, Malcolm headed straight for us and instantly took us under his wing. He patiently spent close to an hour helping my son find the right fit, the right color (for his skin tone) and to match his date’s dress. We found everything we needed except for the tie. We were so very pleased with the purchase we made. But the most important thing we left with, was my son’s confidence! Malcolm told my son “to stand up straight, lift your head up, and be confident in the good looking guy that he is”
As a mom, to a shy teenage boy,  this means the world to me!
When we left to go find the tie at a different store, we were totally lost again. My son said “mom, do you think we can go get Malcolm to help us?” They may not ever see each other again but this guy with the exceptional customer service skills made a LIFELONG impact on my son. Express, I hope you realize how great of an employee you have in Malcolm. I wish the world was filled with more Malcolms.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing what an awesome experience you had with the team at the Bel Air Mall EXPRESS. We forwarded your feedback to the District Manager so that they know what a special time you all had in the store. If you should have any additional questions, feel free to reach us at 1-888-397-1980.

text: This is by far the worst Express I have been to. I was the only customer in the store and not one employee asked if I needed anything. This is not the place I want to give my money too.

name: Alena Tarasevich
text: They have nice clothes that's not affordable to an average college student. I mean prices down south are the exact same prices they have up north (I visited express in Washington State). The only difference is the minimum wage there $15.00

name: Angenette Peterson
text: Love this store. The employees are professional, helpful and friendly. They know me by name. Lol. I found a dress to where to my son's graduration and a concert. My sons love the jackets and jeans i buy here or order on line.

name: Angela Shetlin
text: Love their clothing

name: Jorge Antonio Chay Ulin
text: my favorite place

name: K D
text: Never enough employees staffed anymore. Have to wait and wait for a dressing room when only one other customer in store because only one employee. Poor management.

name: Andrew Clark
text: You pay regular price it seems like on their sales

name: Brian Dunbar
text: Expensive but great fitting clothes.

name: Dave Lewis
text: Dr Day is a great optometrist! He even referred me to the ophthalmologist who did my trifocal lens replacement surgery (souped-up cataract surgery). For me the healing time was very quick and I came out of the procedure already able to see. Now, three months after surgery, I see better than I can remember ever seeing before (my vision is now 20/20). Before surgery my eyes were so bad (about -11) that I was not a candidate for anything but the trifocal lens replacement but I saw it as an investment in my future health as I was getting worried about night driving. So glad I did it!

name: Don Johnson
text: Dr Day is my expert for all things vision. I learn so much every time I go into his office. He handles he vision for all the staff at Freedom Heating and Cooling and everyone loves it.

name: Kathlene Rushing
text: I drove from Pensacola, Florida to see Dr. Day because I can't find anyone like him in Pensacola. Great Doctor!

name: Andrew Miller
text: Got a pair of glasses here couple months ago same day!! These guys really knows the value of customer service. I’ll be sure to recommend any of my family or friends. Thanks Dr. Day, you gave me my eyes back lol

name: Jeff Word
text: The Staff and Doctor are great.  Got glasses while I waited.  They have a sincere care not only for your eye health,  but also your entire well being.  It's worth the drive from Gadsden.  Would recommend to anyone.

name: Andrew Rózsa
text: Dr. Jim Day is a consummate professional. His family has been in Optometry for 3 generations and they carry on an impeccable reputation. Dr. Day keeps up to date with the latest news in optometry, has a deep commitment to our community and for nearly 35 years has provided us with personal and caring service. His friendly and homey clinic puts you to ease immediately as you enter the waiting room. The staff is always ready to help and accommodate (sic!) your needs. I have been using Dr. Day for 30 years and wouldn't think of ever using anybody else's optometry services.

name: Christopher H
text: The most personal service possible, and from an expert too!

name: Adam Westbrook
text: Great service still need to go back for my contacts love my glasses girls at front desk r a hoot

name: Wilda Leary
text: Dr. Day is a 3rd generation optometrist with not only years of experience and skill, but is also active and enthusiastic in research and cutting edge studies that have optimistic advancements for the pathologies of the eye, and the other organs involved in sight. As a physician, I can whole-heartedly recommend him for your ongoing care of all of your vision needs. Moreover, if there is a condition where you need more extensive care, he is well regarded in the tertiary centers and his referrals are given expert care.

name: Tim Thomas
text: Great people, really care about the patients.

name: paul daugh
text: Dr. Day is great.  He is an excellent Dr. and takes the time with you to really know your eye care needs.  I highly recommend him.

name: Ann Jarvis
text: So excited to have them for our vision plan.

name: Dean Ethridge
text: Day Eye Center is a fantastic place to go for professional eye care and equipment.  Dr Day really cares about his patients first and foremost.  You'll love this place

name: Kayla Gast
text:
Unprofessional still have not received my glasses. Will not give you your prescription.
Staff unorganized and untrained.

name: Derma Laser Clinic
text: Day Eye Center has the nicest employees working there.  Dr Day really cares about his patients and takes his time with each of them.  You feel like you're important there, not a number.

name: Jacoby Davani
text:
You may notice that I don’t normally go out of my way to post many reviews unless I’m really impressed with the services provided.... anyways

So, I came in already knowing what I was looking for. I also already had my prescription from an eye exam I had taken the previous week, elsewhere. With that said, I came in- selected my frames and a sales associate was able to quickly get me processed through check out. She was also able to help me maximize the best value based on my needs. I left with plans to come back probably the next day and went to another shop in the mall. On my way out (~30 min) I realized I had missed a text saying they were all completely finished. They had my glasses ready in 15 min. NO LIE!!! I was really impressed and my new glasses are awesome!

name: Gloria Harris
text: My son lost his glasses over spring break and needed glasses to return to school. We arrived at the store at opening and were greeted by Ms Sandra who took excellent care of us the entire time. She practiced COVID precautions and directed us to appropriate frames. She noticed a problem with the prescription from our previous store and assisted us in correcting it. She also handled a hold on our insurance from a prior eyeglass shop. She then informed us of our benefits and assisted us in locating and purchasing frames that were both ready in less than 30 minutes!! The frames were stylish and the final  price was excellent! I was able to get my son to school in a timely manner!  We will be back!

name: mike bolton
text: They did a great job to get me exactly what I wanted. Very friendly and got me in and out quick. Definitely earned my business in the future.

name: Timothy Browder
text: This Eyemart Express in Auburn, AL did an excellent job. The sales associates, including lab staff Lawrence went over the top to fill my glass orders. I purchased 4 pairs, three of which were ready in less than 40 minutes. They even filled a custom order prescription pair that I expected to take 14 days, in 36 minutes. Great job. Highly recommend!

name: Cambrie Rodriguez
text: Great management and extremely professional environment. Loved working with the staff and Sandra is so great!

resp.text: Hi Cambrie Rodriguez! Your satisfaction is very important to us and we are glad we could provide great customer service. If there is anything else that we can do, please feel free to reach out!

name: Reddit User
text: My experience was excellent. Ingrid was fabulous. She is very professional and helpful. All Covid precautions were followed to the letter. I am very satisfied with my experience and I will definitely recommend Eyemart to others.

name: Bill Grace
text: The staff was very friendly courteous efficient and l highly recommend them to anyone needing eye wear help. I will certainly use them in the future!

name: Donna Meade
text: Michael was extremely helpful and courteous while I was picking out my new eyeglasses. He helped me through the insurance process, as I get reimbursed through my plan and he helped me to get a discount that I wasn't aware of!!! That tells me a great deal about this place that they really do value their customers. I will continue to purchase future eyeglasses here for sure. Oh, I did have a bit of a wait because of Covid restrictions and there were other customers in front of me but I'm glad I was patient cause it was worth it.

resp.text: Hi Donna Meade! Mission accomplished! Thank you for your 5-star review! 🙌

name: Lee Kolb
text: Had a very nice day getting new glasses. Michael was awesome and was really great at answering all my questions. I had to get the progressive lenses and they had me all done within a hour of coming in and having my glasses in hand. Very nice experience! Would highly recommend them to everyone.

name: Kristin Hicks
text: All of the staff were so nice and helpful!  They were very knowledgeable about my insurance and helped me get just what I wanted for a great price!  And the glasses were ready in an hour!

name: Cheri Wiggins
text: Shanae was very professional but more than that she was friendly and outgoing.  She helped me to get the best deal and I am thrilled with my new glasses.  Both pair were finished in an hour.  Would highly recommend them.

name: Meacon Tilley
text: It was my first time adulting, and everyone was so helpful and so cheerful. I had picked out 2 pairs of eyeglasses and I didn’t have to wait to have them ordered or anything. Most of the glasses were in the store and didn’t have to be ordered. I asked a lot of questions and they answered everyone without looking irritated. Can’t wait till I go and get more!!

name: LaTraysa Carlisle
text: The were efficient,  very sanitary. Sanitized all glasses touched by customers. Shawna made great recommendations.  Glasses were ready in minutes!

name: Keaton Meredith
text: The staff here was very helpful, friendly, and most importantly, patient. I took quite a while to find my new frames, and they were helpful and gave me useful feedback of what they thought looked good/bad, fit/didn't fit. I never felt rushed or like they thought I was wasting their time. I highly suggest going here for your next pair.

name: Jessica Renfroe
text: Very professional and just very sweet and employees that Seem to enjoy their job. They took the time I needed and helped me pick some glasses that were just right for me. They even loved on my little girl by fixing her play glasses so she could be like mommy!! I was in the clinic for an hour and had both my glasses  and sunglasses ready when I left. Fast and friendly service all the way around. I would highly recommended them! We will be back ❤️ Thank y’all for showing us great customer service ! Sandra and Shanae y’all were great!!

name: Kimberly Wright
text: Wish I could leave zero stars, this place has zero customer service! Need a copy of my husband's prescription emailed to him due to an emergency,  cannot even email it to the email that he has on file for his service there. What a joke!

resp.text: Hi Kimberly! Please reach out to your eye doctor directly! We unfortunately don’t have access to patient records, they’re kept securely at your doctor’s office. Thank you and please contact us at 888-372-2763 if we can help in anyway.

name: Christine Pennyamon
text: Awesome Customer service. I would definitely refer Family and Friends

name: Mallory Jones
text: I had a wonderful experience with Auburn Eyemart Express! I received lots of help in picking out frames and was very happy with their price and discounts. They also had a wonderful selection of frames. I finished picking out everything about 15 minutes before they closed and they STILL got my finished frames to me before they closed for the evening. Such kind and hard working employees! I would definitely recommend going to Eyemart Express!

name: Troy Abrams
text:
I can not say enough great things about this place. The service here was above and beyond what I could have expected. JoAnn was excellent in helping me pick out frames that worked for me and helped me find any benefits to make them as inexpensive as she could.

The gentleman in charge of cutting the lens, Lawrence, was also excellent. I came in at about 3:30-4:00 when they were scheduled to close at five that evening, and Lawrence stayed over closing time to cut the lens for me.

Please consider this location the next time you find yourself in need of glasses. You won’t be disappointed!

name: David Daniel
text: As a first time customer, first time  wearing glasses , they were the most helpful getting the right glasses and fit . Then the glasses were ready in less than 1 hour. Also very helpful with my insurance.

text: I love how cute my glasses turned out! Amber and Sandra helped me find the right frame for me. I have a high prescription and wanted specialty lenses so it took a little longer, but still really quick! Everyone at Eyemart is really nice and super helpful!

name: Bubba Storm
text: Went in to purchase new frames for my daughter & everyone was so helpful. They didn’t try to push her into anything she wasn’t comfortable in. Very friend customer service! Also, the turn around time was phenomenal! We picked out & had our new glasses ready to wear within an hour!! We’ve always had to wait for at least a week for glasses to come back.  We’ll definitely continue using them for frames in the future!

name: L. Tripp
text: The best help and support I have ever had in helping me choose frames. The best experience I have ever had. I will be back. Thank you.

name: Tuny Nunn
text: Very professional fast and courteous service, very nice environment, wonderful experience.

resp.text: Hi Tuny Nunn! Thank you for the 5 star review!

name: April
text: The first time I visited I didn’t realize they had just closed and the door was unlocked so I walked in. I was speaking with one of the girls who was very friendly and outgoing and the manager (I’m assuming) wanted to close the store and started waving at the girl helping us, basically implying we needed to leave. I thought this was a little rude. Decided to give them another try and wasn’t impressed at all. This time saw another salesperson, not very knowledgeable which made me feel uneasy because it’s my first pair of glasses. There’s only about 20 frames that fall into the promotion deal so it took me a while to decide. She kept standing right beside me waiting so I felt rushed. The manager came out and told me it would be $70 to add AR. It ended up being $124 because they failed to tell me it’s less money if you send them out to be done vs. in store. I didn’t even get the one hour service because their machine was down so I had to come back the next day. The salesperson didn’t seem to care about any of these issues. I also had to ask her to get a case with them. She just handed me my glasses at first and said here you go. Won’t ever use this store again.

resp.text:
Hello April, thank you for sharing your experience. It looks like there are several areas to address and improve. We are very sorry we didn't gain your future business and we will definitely do training on these specific issues. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if we can improve your experience. We are here to help. Mary, Eyemart Express Customer Care Manager
Dallas, TX 888-372-2763

name: cameron cason
text: Sandra was so sweet! Even though I already had an idea of what kind of glasses I wanted, Sandra thoroughly explained to me what lens options/materials would be the perfect match for me. Eyemart is also very reasonably priced and the environment itself is all around fantastic. I would highly recommend Eyemart Express to anyone in need of glasses!!

text: Eyemart Express at the Mall was an amazing experience. From the second I walked in I was taken care of in a relaxed and professional manner. If you want glasses done right, great price, amazing service then come here!

$120 and 20 minutes later I had my new pair of glasses and I like them better than the expensive pair that didn’t even last 1 year!!!
Very impressed... I highly recommend Eyemart Express in Auburn, Alabama!
Service was excellent and they helped me find glasses within my budget that I absolutely love!👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

text: JoAnn in Auburn mall helped my daughter choose frames. She was so very helpful. Finished glasses were ready in about 30 minutes!

name: Daisy Benford
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. I had to go back 2 weeks after getting my glasses because of my prescription change. They were more than willing to fix my lenses. No problem getting them adjusted. Be sure to ask for the teacher or military discount.

name: Visionary Art Photography
text: This was a wonderful experience at this location. I went in and was greeted immediately and helped. I end up getting two pair of glasses in less then an hour. This staff made my experience so much better and I will be a repeat customer.

name: Ruth Toles
text: IT'S  WAS A GREAT EXPERIENCE AND  I AM ENJOYING  MY NEW GLASSES.

name: Klean Media Group
text: First and foremost, I absolutely love how my glasses came out. I bought two pair and they both equaled a total of $63.99. However, the service was suspicious to say the least. Eyemart is advertising multiple pairs of glasses, at an affordable rate. When I went into the store, I noticed the employees were seemingly very nice and eager to help. Long story short, when it came time to purchase my glasses they were tremendously higher then I expected. My total came out to be $143.99 originally. I thought that was strange so I just simply asked is there not a more standard lens that I could get? Suddenly the employee gets nervous, as if I've asked a question that's too sensitive for her to answer. Her boss reacted rather strangely as well. What had happened was, they had rung me up for two pairs of glasses and lenses and instead of asking me what lenses I would like or giving me choices on what they have; they simply just charged me for the most expensive and weren't even trying to provide me with any options. This was very upsetting to me simply because their advertisement says one thing, yet they are not at all trying to correlate such through their services. What is even worse, is that the manager actually brought me an example of what I would be buying going with the cheaper option. Let me be the first to tell you the example she brought out was not what I ended up buying. Which leads me to believe that Eyemart is only after your money. Granted I got my glasses within literally 30 minutes I was a little bit taken back by my experience considering I was trying to be bamboozled. If you go into this store they have a great selection, and I suggest that you go with whatever you like, but I would be very wary of their service and also be sure to ask questions. Thank you.

resp.text:
Hello, thank you for your review. I'm sorry to hear to had a bad experience at our Auburn, AL location. This is not the way Eyemart Express does business. I will have this review formalized and sent to upper management to prevent this from happening again in the future. Thank you again for taking the time to leave us feedback so we can continue to grow as a company. If there is anything else we can do for you please contact our customer service line at 1-888-372-2763. -Mandolin W.
Eyemart Express Customer Care
Dallas, TX 1-888-372-2763

name: Lakesha Hart
text: Staff is super friendly, courteous and very knowledgeable about eyeware!!!

name: Debbie Waldroup
text:
The first visit went ok as far as the people being friendly and examing us. we have BCBS Insurance I called ahead to see if they took the Insurance she said yes. We go to our appointment and she takes our card she has to see it or she wouldn't of known they didn't take our insurance because of the mcr on it she didn't tell us nothing about it or we would of went some where else. Our insurance pays for the eye exam and 100.00 towards frames and /or lenses however u want to use it. We take our exams and I come out to the lobby while my eyes are dilating she said I could get with the receptionist and pay or do what I needed to do. Ok  I tell her that I shouldn't owe her anything that our insurance pays for the exam and 100.00 for frames.  I told her I called before we came in to make sure you took our insurance if u didn't we would of gone somewhere else. Then she said that she didn't know we had mct by talking to me on the phone. Ok you shouldn't of said you take it u should of asked about the mcr on the card first before saying I took it. The thing that really got me is I'll give her the phone call. But when we went in for our appointment and she made copies of our cards and highlighted where we had MCR she knew then they didn't take our insurance but she didn't tell us until after we both had our exams and was leaving. I told her that she did not tell us that or we would of went somewhere else. I told her she could file the claim and hope they pay it. We were not very happy about that.
We go next door to get our glasses thinking we can do all of this in one day and be done with it. Wrong again I called and asked did they take our insurance yes we do they just didn't bother to tell me that the machine tht runs the card through hasn't been sent to them yet and they have no way of filing our insurance. But we will call you when it comes in. How long will that be? I'm sorry I have no idea??  So we either go somewhere else or go home and wait on there call thinking it will be just a few days Wrong again. It was a long time before they called us. So we were still aggerivated about the whole thing we weren't sure wether to go back there or not. We did decide that if the insurance didn't pay for the exam that they could write it off or do whatever they wanted to do with that bill we werent going to pay it cause she knew before we had the exams and done them anyway without giving us a choice to have them done or not. So far I haven't got a bill from them or anything from my insurance.
They finally call us and say they can take our insurance now. So my husband goes and gets his done. They look good on him and so far he's satisified.
I went Wednesday and got mine done and picked them up Friday so far I'm very happy with them. I bought the 29.95 year warranty I have narcolepsy and I fall and drop them all the time. I can mess them up I have had my dog to eat them and I'm being serious. I woke up and she was crunching on something I was trying to find my glasses to see what she had  that's when I found the frames.
The people were very nice, the place was nice they just need to have there knowledge together and tell people the right thing and most important tell them if you don't take their insurance before you do nothing to them. We were nice. There's allot of people hat would of caused a big big scene.
Thank you!!
Have a Nice Day!!!!

Debbie Waldroup
